events.message: The insured reported a car collision that occurred on April 30th involving their vehicle and another car at a stoplight.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and confirming keywords related to a vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the case and will coordinate further investigation and communication with the insured.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment notice to the customer confirming receipt of the accident claim and next steps.
The agent requested photographs of the damaged vehicle, the police accident report, and a copy of the driver's license for processing.
The customer submitted all requested documents including photos, police report, and identification via the online claims portal.
An internal investigation was initiated to verify details of the collision and assess liability based on the submitted evidence.
The investigation concluded confirming the insured was not at fault in the accident and damage estimates were reviewed.
A settlement proposal was sent to the customer outlining coverage amounts for repairs and rental car reimbursement.
The insured responded approving the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the speed of processing the claim.
The claim was officially approved for payment based on customer acceptance and investigation results.
Payment for approved damages was issued to the insuredâ€™s bank account with confirmation sent via email.
The claim was formally closed once payment was received and no further actions were requested by the customer.
